01 / 12

Chromatic Rebellion

2024

A bold exploration of color theory meets contemporary street culture. This editorial piece challenges traditional fashion boundaries by juxtaposing vibrant textiles with minimalist urban landscapes. Each frame captures the tension between structure and chaos, creating a visual narrative that speaks to modern identity formation.

Photography: Marcus Chen
Styling: Trish Kennedy
Makeup Artist: Zoe Williams
Model: Ava Martinez
Set Design: Studio Noir
02 / 12

Noir Reverie

2024

Returning to the essence of black and white photography, this series strips away color to reveal pure form and emotion. Inspired by 1950s Hollywood glamour, the styling merges vintage silhouettes with modern fabrication techniques, creating timeless pieces that transcend era.

Photography: Isabella Romano
Styling: Trish Kennedy
Hair Styling: Jordan Blake
Model: Naomi Okafor
03 / 12

Fabricated Dreams

2023

An intimate study of texture and materiality. This project showcases emerging designers who work with sustainable and innovative textiles. The styling emphasizes tactile qualities, inviting viewers to imagine the sensation of each fabric against skin. Shot in natural light to honor the organic nature of the materials.

Photography: Liam Foster
Styling: Trish Kennedy
Makeup Artist: Aisha Patel
Models: Collective Cast
04 / 12

Structure & Flow

2023

Where architecture meets fashion design. This editorial explores the relationship between built environments and body-worn structures. Sharp lines contrast with flowing fabrics, creating dynamic compositions that challenge our perception of space and form.

Photography: Sofia Andersson
Styling: Trish Kennedy
Hair & Makeup: Taylor Kim
Model: Claudia Santos
Location: Brutalist Archive
05 / 12

Heritage Reimagined

2023

A celebration of cultural identity through contemporary styling. This series honors traditional craftsmanship while reimagining heritage garments for the modern wardrobe. Each piece tells a story of migration, memory, and creative evolution.

Photography: Kwame Asante
Styling: Trish Kennedy
Makeup Artist: Amara Johnson
Model: Destiny Moore
06 / 12

Tomorrow's Silhouette

2022

Speculative fashion for an uncertain future. This forward-thinking editorial imagines clothing as adaptive technology—garments that respond to environment, emotion, and identity. The styling emphasizes innovation in cut, material, and conceptual approach.

Photography: Yuki Tanaka
Styling: Trish Kennedy
Hair Styling: River Stone
Model: Nova Chen
Digital Art: Pixel Labs
07 / 12

Earth Tones

2022

A return to nature through fashion. Earthy palettes, organic shapes, and sustainable materials create harmony between human form and natural environment. Shot on location in remote landscapes, this series celebrates simplicity and conscious design.

Photography: Elena Volkov
Styling: Trish Kennedy
Makeup Artist: Chloe Bernard
Model: Sienna Roberts
08 / 12

Deconstruction

2022

Fashion as conceptual art. This provocative series questions the very nature of clothing—what defines a garment? How do we construct identity through dress? The styling deliberately subverts expectations, creating wearable sculptures that challenge conventional beauty standards.

Photography: Diego Ramirez
Styling: Trish Kennedy
Hair & Makeup: Sasha Ivanov
Model: Phoenix Lee
09 / 12

Gilded Age

2021

Opulence redefined for contemporary tastes. This luxury editorial celebrates craftsmanship, featuring couture pieces from emerging and established designers. Rich textures, intricate details, and sumptuous fabrics create a visual feast of refined elegance.

Photography: Valentina Rossi
Styling: Trish Kennedy
Makeup Artist: Laurent Dubois
Model: Anastasia Volkov
Location: Château Moderne
10 / 12

Urban Poetry

2021

The city as runway. This energetic series captures the authentic spirit of street fashion—unfiltered, diverse, and constantly evolving. Styling emphasizes individuality and self-expression, celebrating the creativity found in everyday urban life.

Photography: Jamal Washington
Styling: Trish Kennedy
Hair Styling: Maya Thompson
Models: Street Cast
11 / 12

Liminal Spaces

2021

Fashion exists in the in-between. This contemplative series explores transitional moments—dawn, dusk, doorways, thresholds. The styling creates visual metaphors for transformation, using light, shadow, and movement to capture fleeting emotions.

Photography: Otto Schmidt
Styling: Trish Kennedy
Makeup Artist: Luna Park
Model: Echo Martinez
12 / 12

The Journey Continues

2025

A culmination of creative exploration and a promise of future innovation. This final spread represents not an ending, but a new beginning—the evolution of a creative practice that continues to push boundaries and redefine contemporary styling.

Photography: Various Artists
Styling: Trish Kennedy
Creative Direction: TK Curated

TRISH
KENNEDY

Creative Director & Stylist

A versatile creative force bridging Houston and Lagos, Trish Kennedy has spent the past decade transforming vision into visual narrative. From runway to editorial, her work embodies the intersection of cultural heritage, contemporary innovation, and artistic excellence.

TK

"Fashion is not about clothes—it's about creating moments that live beyond the frame."

What drew you to creative direction and styling?
It was organic, really. I started modeling in 2017, and I was constantly surrounded by incredible garments and creative energy on set. I found myself naturally gravitating toward styling—not just for myself, but for other models too. By 2020, I had transitioned fully into styling and fashion design. I realized I loved the entire creative process: the conceptualization, the collaboration, bringing someone's vision to life. That's when I knew this was my path.
How do you describe your aesthetic?
I'd say it's intentional yet fluid. I draw inspiration from everything—architecture, music, street culture, heritage textiles. My approach is about finding balance: structure with movement, tradition with innovation, boldness with subtlety. Every project is different, but there's always an underlying thread of authenticity and purpose.
"I never anticipated that my curiosity for creativity would lead me this far, but it certainly has."
What has been your most challenging project?
Every project has its own set of challenges, but one that stands out was an editorial shoot in Lagos where we had to work with limited resources and unpredictable weather. It taught me the importance of adaptability and creative problem-solving. Some of the best images from that shoot came from spontaneous decisions we made on location. That's the beauty of this work—constraints can spark the most innovative solutions.
How do you approach collaboration?
Collaboration is everything. I work closely with photographers, makeup artists, models, and set designers to create a unified vision. I'm a firm believer that the best work comes from listening—understanding what everyone brings to the table and finding ways to elevate the collective output. It's not about imposing my vision; it's about co-creating something greater than the sum of its parts.
8+
Years of Creative Excellence
What's next for TK Curated?
The journey is just beginning. I'm excited to expand into more international markets, collaborate with emerging designers, and continue pushing the boundaries of what fashion styling can be. I'm also passionate about mentorship—helping the next generation of creatives find their voice and build sustainable careers in this industry. The future holds so much possibility, and I can't wait to see what we create together.
"Fashion is a conversation—between past and present, body and fabric, artist and audience."

Frequently Asked Questions

TK Curated specializes in creative direction, editorial styling, campaign development, personal styling, wardrobe consulting, and fashion consultation for photoshoots, events, and brand activations. We work across commercial and editorial projects, tailoring our approach to each client's unique vision and goals.

Rates vary based on project scope, timeline, and complexity. Editorial day rates start at $1,500, while campaign and creative direction projects are quoted individually. A 50% deposit is required to secure booking dates. Rush fees apply for projects with less than two weeks' notice. Contact us for a detailed quote tailored to your specific needs.

We recommend booking at least 4-6 weeks in advance for editorial projects and 8-12 weeks for larger campaigns or events. This allows adequate time for concept development, sourcing, and preparation. However, we do accept rush projects based on availability, with applicable rush fees.

Wardrobe sourcing is included in our styling services. We work with an extensive network of designers, showrooms, and rental houses to curate pieces that align with your project vision. Clients are responsible for wardrobe budgets, rental fees, and any associated costs. We can also work with client-provided wardrobes if preferred.

Usage rights are negotiated per project and detailed in the contract. Standard editorial work includes one-time publication rights. Commercial and campaign work requires licensing agreements that specify usage duration, territories, and platforms. Additional fees apply for extended or exclusive usage. We retain the right to use images in our portfolio unless otherwise agreed.

Yes, we work on projects worldwide. We're based between Houston, TX and Lagos, Nigeria, but frequently travel for shoots and events. Travel expenses—including airfare, accommodation, ground transportation, and per diem—are billed separately and agreed upon in advance. International projects typically require a 50% deposit to cover travel booking.

Cancellations or rescheduling requests made more than 14 days before the shoot date incur no penalty. Within 14 days, a 25% fee applies. Within 7 days, 50%. Cancellations within 48 hours forfeit the full deposit. We understand that unforeseen circumstances arise and will work with clients to find mutually agreeable solutions whenever possible.

While we prefer adequate lead time for optimal results, we can accommodate rush requests based on current availability and project feasibility. Same-day and last-minute bookings (less than 72 hours) incur a 100% rush fee. Wardrobe options may be limited due to sourcing constraints, but we'll work with available resources to deliver the best possible outcome.

Client satisfaction is our priority. If the final result doesn't meet agreed-upon specifications outlined in our contract, we'll discuss reasonable adjustments. Reshoots due to styling issues are evaluated case-by-case. However, reshoots requested due to changes in creative direction, photography, or other factors outside styling are billed as new projects.

Getting started is simple. Fill out our Commission Brief form above with details about your project, vision, timeline, and budget. We'll review your submission and respond within 48-72 hours to schedule an initial consultation. From there, we'll develop a proposal tailored to your needs, finalize the agreement, and begin bringing your vision to life.
